title: Business & Finance
text:
---

Micron Technology and Western Digital are each exploring a potential deal for Kioxia that could value the Japanese semiconductor company at about $30 billion.

---

Huawei suffered a rare decline in revenue during the fourth quarter last year, as U.S. sanctions hammered its business and sales outside of China fell particularly hard.

---

Ford is scheduling more downtime at several U.S. factories, including its two major truck plants, amid a global chip shortage.

---

Dozens of prominent Black executives called on corporations to fight Republican-led legislation they say would limit voting access for Black voters in numerous states.

---

H&M said it would stand by a human-rights position that angered Beijing and triggered the brand's disappearance from the internet in China.

---

Shares of Deliveroo sank 26% in their trading debut as investors shunned the Amazon -backed food-delivery startup's offering.

---

Microsoft agreed to build custom augmented-reality headsets for the U.S. Army in a deal valued at up to $21.9 billion.
